text: hi guys
it's angel today I'm excited to share my
recipe of Taiwanese pineapple cakes now
this is my very first baking video
tutorial so it's kind of an exciting
moment for me but I wanted to show this
recipe because it's a very famous pastry
that's one of Thailand's best food
souvenirs in Taiwanese we call this my
salt and the interesting thing about it
is that they're typically made with a
winter melon filling instead of
pineapple because winter melon in Taiwan
is less expensive but since we're making
this at home I'm going to go ahead and
use pineapple in this recipe because I
just don't feel right using winter melon
here so with that let's get started and
I will show you guys how to make
Tammany's panel okay
at home first let's go over the
ingredients for the pineapple filling
we'll need 1/4 cup of cane sugar 1/4 cup
of light brown sugar
we'll need 1 20 ounce can of crushed
pineapple now if you can't find crushed
pineapple you can also use sliced
pineapple or even fresh pineapple we'll
basically want about a cup and a half of
crushed pineapple that's been fully
trained and removed at the liquid
finally we'll need 1 teaspoon of lemon
juice now let's prep our pineapple if
you're using canned pineapple strain and
drain the liquid then using a spatula
press and remove as much liquid as you
can a little liquid is okay but not too
much in the end we should have at least
one and a half cups of crushed pineapple
now let's cut the filling in a saucepan
over medium heat add the crushed
pineapple then both the cane and brown
sugars and finally the lemon juice which
will give us a bit of tartness stir
frequently and cook until the pineapples
are soft and the liquid has evaporated
after about 10 minutes it should have
thickened to a gem like texture like
this
when you're done transfer it to a bowl
to let the filling cool once it's cold
put it in the fridge to chill and ferma
now for the shortbread start with one
stick of room temperature unsalted
butter and mix together the butter and
powdered sugar first
once those are creamed together then you
can add the salt if you're using
unsalted butter your baking powder the
powdered milk and a whole egg mix
everything again then slowly add in the
sifted cake flour once the dough is
mixed completely lightly flour
countertop or cutting board to make the
shortbread next roll the dough into a
log shape and divide into three pieces
it doesn't have to be exact
rough estimates are fine then with one
of those pieces roll into another log
and divide again into three pieces
repeat until you have nine pieces total
now for the fun part roll one of the
pieces of dough into a ball then gently
flatten into a circle shape with your
hands or a rolling pin the circle should
be about three inches in diameter then
take a scoop of the chilled pond apple
filling and place it in the center of
the dough about one tablespoon is good
next close and pinch together the dough
removing any excess dough if needed then
roll and mold into a smooth pineapple
ball when you're done place the ball
into a square or rectangle pineapple
cake frame and with the palm of your
hand gently press down to flatten the
dough should be a bit lower than the top
of the frame because it will expand
during baking repeat this process until
you've made all nine of the pineapple
cakes now let's bake in a preheated oven
bake your pineapple cakes at 330 degrees
for 10 minutes
after 10 minutes remove and carefully
flip the cakes over then bake for
another five to seven minutes
once they're done cooking remove the
frames and let the pineapple cakes cool
before eating and sharing
so this is how you make Taiwanese
pineapple cakes I love to eat my cakes
served slightly warm with a glass of hot
milk tea or bubble tea if you do end up
trying this recipe at home please take a
selfie with your cakes I would love to
see how they turned out for you so until
then I will see you guys next time bye
